startbox 0.0.0.9000

Perform ANOVA or Kruskal-Wallis test and group comparison

test_stats.Rd

This function performs an ANOVA or Kruskal-Wallis test depending on the assumptions of normality and homoscedasticity. It then returns a summary of statistical groups using a post-hoc SNK test (for ANOVA) or Kruskal-Conover test.

Utilisation

test_stats(
  data,
  value_col = "PM_LEAF_PC",
  trt_col = "xp_trt_code",
  alpha = 0.05,
  group_method = "SNK",
  force_test = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

data

A data.frame with at least a column of values and a grouping factor.

value_col

Column name (string) with numeric values.

trt_col

Column name (string) with grouping (default: "xp_trt_code").

alpha

Significance threshold (default = 0.05).

group_method

"SNK" or "LSD" for ANOVA; always "kruskal" for Kruskal-Wallis.

force_test

Force "anova" or "kruskal" (bypass assumptions).

verbose

Logical. If TRUE, prints diagnostic messages.

Valeur de retour

A list with the following elements:

  • test A string indicating the test used: "Anova", "Kruskal", or "Non applicable".

  • p_value The p-value of the global test.

  • groupes A data.frame with three columns: modality, mean, and groups. The groups column contains statistical group letters.

A list with test name, p-value and group letters.

Détails

If xp _trt_code is not provided, it is inferred from the plot_id column: numeric plot codes are extracted from the beginning of the string (e.g. "10A" to 10), and "TNT" is used directly for untreated control plots.

Group comparison is only meaningful if the global test (ANOVA or Kruskal-Wallis) is statistically significant.
